text: <a href="../1-Samuel-9-1/" title="1 Samuel 9:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name *was* Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a mighty man of power.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-2/" title="1 Samuel 9:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And he had a son, whose name *was* Saul, a choice young man, and a goodly: and *there was* not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward *he was* higher than any of the people.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-3/" title="1 Samuel 9:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And the asses of Kish Saul's father were lost. And Kish said to Saul his son, Take now one of the servants with thee, and arise, go seek the asses.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-4/" title="1 Samuel 9:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And he passed through mount Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalisha, but they found *them* not: then they passed through the land of Shalim, and *there they were* not: and he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they found *them* not.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-5/" title="1 Samuel 9:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 *And* when they were come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant that *was* with him, Come, and let us return; lest my father leave *caring* for the asses, and take thought for us.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-6/" title="1 Samuel 9:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And he said unto him, Behold now, *there is* in this city a man of God, and *he is* an honourable man; all that he saith cometh surely to pass: now let us go thither; peradventure he can shew us our way that we should go.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-7/" title="1 Samuel 9:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Then said Saul to his servant, But, behold, *if* we go, what shall we bring the man? for the bread is spent in our vessels, and *there is* not a present to bring to the man of God: what have we?

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-8/" title="1 Samuel 9:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And the servant answered Saul again, and said, Behold, I have here at hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver: *that* will I give to the man of God, to tell us our way.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-9/" title="1 Samuel 9:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 (Beforetime in Israel, when a man went to enquire of God, thus he spake, Come, and let us go to the seer: for *he that is* now *called* a Prophet was beforetime called a Seer.)

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-10/" title="1 Samuel 9:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Then said Saul to his servant, Well said; come, let us go. So they went unto the city where the man of God *was*.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-11/" title="1 Samuel 9:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 *And* as they went up the hill to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said unto them, Is the seer here?

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-12/" title="1 Samuel 9:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And they answered them, and said, He is; behold, *he is* before you: make haste now, for he came to day to the city; for *there is* a sacrifice of the people to day in the high place:

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-13/" title="1 Samuel 9:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 As soon as ye be come into the city, ye shall straightway find him, before he go up to the high place to eat: for the people will not eat until he come, because he doth bless the sacrifice; *and* afterwards they eat that be bidden. Now therefore get you up; for about this time ye shall find him.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-14/" title="1 Samuel 9:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And they went up into the city: *and* when they were come into the city, behold, Samuel came out against them, for to go up to the high place.
<a href="../1-Samuel-9-15/" title="1 Samuel 9:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Now the LORD had told Samuel in his ear a day before Saul came, saying,

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-16/" title="1 Samuel 9:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 To morrow about this time I will send thee a man out of the land of Benjamin, and thou shalt anoint him *to be* captain over my people Israel, that he may save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked upon my people, because their cry is come unto me.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-17/" title="1 Samuel 9:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And when Samuel saw Saul, the LORD said unto him, Behold the man whom I spake to thee of! this same shall reign over my people.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-18/" title="1 Samuel 9:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, where the seer's house *is*.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-19/" title="1 Samuel 9:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 And Samuel answered Saul, and said, I *am* the seer: go up before me unto the high place; for ye shall eat with me to day, and to morrow I will let thee go, and will tell thee all that *is* in thine heart.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-20/" title="1 Samuel 9:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago, set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And on whom *is* all the desire of Israel? *Is it* not on thee, and on all thy father's house?

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-21/" title="1 Samuel 9:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And Saul answered and said, *Am* not I a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? wherefore then speakest thou so to me?

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-22/" title="1 Samuel 9:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 And Samuel took Saul and his servant, and brought them into the parlour, and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden, which *were* about thirty persons.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-23/" title="1 Samuel 9:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 And Samuel said unto the cook, Bring the portion which I gave thee, of which I said unto thee, Set it by thee.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-24/" title="1 Samuel 9:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And the cook took up the shoulder, and *that* which *was* upon it, and set *it* before Saul. And *Samuel* said, Behold that which is left! set *it* before thee, *and* eat: for unto this time hath it been kept for thee since I said, I have invited the people. So Saul did eat with Samuel that day.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-25/" title="1 Samuel 9:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 And when they were come down from the high place into the city, *Samuel* communed with Saul upon the top of the house.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-26/" title="1 Samuel 9:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And they arose early: and it came to pass about the spring of the day, that Samuel called Saul to the top of the house, saying, Up, that I may send thee away. And Saul arose, and they went out both of them, he and Samuel, abroad.

<a href="../1-Samuel-9-27/" title="1 Samuel 9:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 *And* as they were going down to the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, Bid the servant pass on before us, (and he passed on,) but stand thou still a while, that I may shew thee the word of God.
